message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient displays several symptoms of conduct disorder, including defiance, aggression, and disregard for others' feelings. These symptoms may progress to antisocial personality disorder in adulthood, so option C is the most accurate statement. Option A is unlikely, as the patient's behavior is causing difficulties at home and school. Option B is premature, as the patient is still a child and has not been formally diagnosed with antisocial personality disorder. Option D is incorrect, as there is no medication specifically indicated for conduct disorder or antisocial personality disorder. Behavioral interventions, family therapy, and cognitive-behavioral therapy are recommended treatments for conduct disorder.
